conclusion: To determine whether point O1 is to the right of point O, we need to analyze the refraction of light as it passes from air into water.
When light travels from one medium to another (in this case, from air to water), it changes speed and direction. This phenomenon is called refraction.
The angle of incidence is different from the angle of refraction.
Snell's Law describes the relationship between the angles of incidence and refraction.
Since the refractive index of water is greater than that of air, the light will bend towards the normal when entering the water.
Point O is the intersection of the line AB and the boundary between air and water.
Point O1 is the point on the boundary where the light initially enters the water from air.

premise: As the light enters the water from air, it bends towards the normal.
conclusion: The angle of refraction is smaller than the angle of incidence.

premise: The refracted ray will be closer to the normal than the incident ray.
conclusion: Point O1 will be to the right of point O.

premise: Point O1 is to the right of point O.
conclusion: Yes, point O1 is to the right of point O.
